title: [Large-Scale] Pedagogical Design for Developing Computational Thinking Based on Elementary Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and general pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Plugged CT Integration for Elementary Math: Non-Programming Computational Thinking Strategies for Pre-Service Teachers/Educational Technologists

learning_goals: Learners can explain CT (Computational Thinking) instructional design principles for applying decomposition, algorithmic thinking, and problem-solving strategies to elementary math problems.
Develop at least three activity modules integrating mathematical thinking and CT elements in a non-programming plugged learning environment
Analyze implementation issues (e.g., tool appropriateness, task difficulty) in CT-based lesson design and propose improvement strategies

resources: CT (Computational Thinking) Manipulative Set (Unplugged Activity Kit)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
